description: From Mithridates +â€Ž -ize, in reference to Mithridates VI of Pontus.

verbs.description: mithridatize (third-person singular simple present mithridatizes, present participle mithridatizing, simple past and past participle mithridatized)

entries.meaning: (US) To make immune to a poison by administration of gradually increasing doses.
examples: Our constitutions adapt themselves to the slow poison of the world till we become mithridatized at last.
